page.title: 02TRANSPORT FOR SANDHEAD
page.content: by Diane McColm aged 12 Around this area we have very little Public Transport. Three buses per day pass through the village on their way to Stranraer. They come at 8-30am, 11-30am, and 5-10pm. On Sunday the buses don't even run. A private coach hirer and two taxi firms are used extensively by both people with cars and those without. Obviously cars in this area are very important. What would people do if they couldn't get to their work in the morning? They couldn't all get taxis every morning and the bus comes too late for the factories. Many people share the cost of travelling to and from Stranraer with car-owning friends. Our local town of Stranraer has a population of 10 000 and in the area we have 5 dealers for new cars!
